intro: Centaurea gabrieljanae, commonly known as Gabriel's centaury, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in temperate climates. It features slender, branching stems with narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces striking blue to purple flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
